text: simple syrup is vital for locking in
moisture in your cakes especially when
you squeeze it at us or squeeze a lot my
simple syrup companion yes you are my
companion you start by pouring 2 cups of
water and then 2 cups of sugar into a
pot you can make as much or as little as
you want as long as it's an equal
measure
put it over high heat and let it come to
a rolling boil fully bubbly boiling for
sure and take it off the heat and let it
cool completely then using a funnel pour
your cooled simple syrup into sir suiza
you can try and rapport it without a
funnel but I don't do this I know then I
know they should know the holes in the
top of sir squeeze a lot allow the
perfect amount of syrup out when
showering your cake
you don't want to over soak and make
your cake soggy this means a lot I just
love your little shower hole that's nice
favorite thing you can get Meister's
fees alot syrup bottle at how to take it
